info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 06 at 5:00PM EDT until August 06 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Forsyth County in central North Carolina... Northwestern Moore County in central North Carolina... Eastern Davidson County in central North Carolina... Montgomery County in central North Carolina... Randolph County in central North Carolina... Guilford County in central North Carolina... * Until 600 PM EDT. * At 500 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Kernersville to 9 miles northeast of Ansonville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Greensboro, High Point, Asheboro, Randleman, Troy, North Carolina Zoo, Badin Lake, Thomasville, Kernersville and Biscoe. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
